name: Berlin
description: The capital city of Germany, also a federal state in its own right.

name: Hamburg
description: A city-state in northern Germany, known for its port and maritime heritage.

name: Bremen
description: A city-state in northwestern Germany, part of the Bremen-Oldenburg metropolitan region.

name: Munich
description: The capital of Bavaria, famous for its Oktoberfest and cultural attractions.

name: Stuttgart
description: The capital of Baden-Württemberg, a hub for the automotive industry.

name: Düsseldorf
description: The capital of North Rhine-Westphalia, known for its fashion industry and art scene.

name: Hannover
description: The capital of Lower Saxony, known for its trade fairs and gardens.

name: Wiesbaden
description: The capital of Hesse, famous for its thermal springs and spa culture.

name: Mainz
description: The capital of Rhineland-Palatinate, known for its Roman history and wine culture.

name: Saarbrücken
description: The capital of Saarland, located near the French border.

name: Kiel
description: The capital of Schleswig-Holstein, known for its maritime heritage and proximity to the Baltic Sea.

name: Magdeburg
description: The capital of Saxony-Anhalt, a city with a rich medieval history.

name: Potsdam
description: The capital of Brandenburg, known for its palaces and parks.

name: Erfurt
description: The capital of Thuringia, famous for its well-preserved medieval city center.

name: Dresden
description: The capital of Saxony, known for its art museums and Baroque architecture.

name: Schwerin
description: The capital of Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, known for its picturesque lakes and castles.
